title: MDN Web Docs
description: It is a documentation repository and learning resource for web developers. It was started by Mozilla in 2005 as a unified place for documentation about open web standards, Mozilla's own projects, and developer guides.Topics include HTML5, JavaScript, CSS, Web APIs, Django, Node.js, WebExtensions, MathML, and others.

title: W3Schools
description: W3Schools is a freemium educational website for learning coding online. Initially released in 1998, it derives its name from the World Wide Web but is not affiliated with the W3 Consortium. W3Schools offers courses covering all aspects of web development. W3Schools also publishes free HTML templates.

title: javascripttutorial.net
description: Welcome to the JavaScriptTutorial.net website! This JavaScript Tutorial helps you learn the JavaScript programming language from scratch quickly and effectively.

title: javascript.info
description: The Modern JavaScript Tutorial. From the basics to advanced topics with simple, but detailed explanations. Here we learn JavaScript, starting from scratch and go on to advanced concepts like OOP. We concentrate on the language itself here, with the minimum of environment-specific notes.

title: codementor
description: From the basics to advanced topics with simple, but detailed explanations. Get help from vetted software developers. One-on-one live mentorship and debug with the help of an expert
